result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard David Kritz Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Zachary Hoff appeared by video for Richard David Kritz Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Richard David Kritz in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Josh Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional time to meet with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JAK (05/08/1983).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Any cash bail on deposit to be returned to the surety.

Defendant Richard David Kritz in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 35.   Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/26/22 @ 2p
